001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
006
007import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
008import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
009
010
011/**
012 * This class defines methods for estimating the extrinsic camera parameters
013 * from multiple homographies.
014 * 
015 * @author W. Burger
016 *
017 */
018public class ExtrinsicViewEstimator {
019        
020        static boolean beVerbose = false;
021        
022        private final RealMatrix A_inv;
023        
024        /**
025         * The only constructor.
026         * @param A the 3 x 3 matrix with intrinsic camera parameters
027         */
028        protected ExtrinsicViewEstimator(RealMatrix A) {
029                this.A_inv = MatrixUtils.inverse(A);
030        }
031        
032        /**
033         * Estimates the extrinsic camera parameters for a sequence of homographies.
034         * @param homographies a set of homographies given as 3 x 3 matrices
035         * @return the sequence of extrinsic camera parameters (views), one view for each homography
036         */
037        protected ViewTransform[] getExtrinsics(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
038                final int M = homographies.length;
039                ViewTransform[] views = new ViewTransform[M];
040                //ExtrinsicViewEstimator eve = new ExtrinsicViewEstimator(A);
041                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
042                        views[i] = estimateViewTransform(homographies[i]);
043                }
044                return views;
045        }
046        
047        private ViewTransform estimateViewTransform(RealMatrix H) {
048                RealVector h0 = H.getColumnVector(0);
049                RealVector h1 = H.getColumnVector(1);
050                RealVector h2 = H.getColumnVector(2);
051
052                double lambda = 1 / A_inv.operate(h0).getNorm();
053                if (beVerbose) {
054                        System.out.format("lambda = %f\n", lambda);
055                }
056
057                // compute the columns in the rotation matrix
058                RealVector r0 = A_inv.operate(h0).mapMultiplyToSelf(lambda);
059                RealVector r1 = A_inv.operate(h1).mapMultiplyToSelf(lambda);
060                RealVector r2 = MathUtil.crossProduct3x3(r0, r1);
061                RealVector t  = A_inv.operate(h2).mapMultiplyToSelf(lambda);
062                
063                if (beVerbose) {
064                        System.out.println("r1 = " + Matrix.toString(r0.toArray()));
065                        System.out.println("r2 = " + Matrix.toString(r1.toArray()));
066                        System.out.println("t = " + Matrix.toString(t.toArray()));
067                }
068                
069                RealMatrix R = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 3);
070                R.setColumnVector(0, r0);
071                R.setColumnVector(1, r1);
072                R.setColumnVector(2, r2);
073                if (beVerbose) {
074                        System.out.println("Rinit = \n" + Matrix.toString(R.getData()));
075                }
076                                
077//              // the R matrix is probably not a real rotation matrix.  So find
078//              // the closest real rotation matrix
079//              RealMatrix R = MathUtil.approximateRotationMatrix(R);   // not needed, View takes care of this
080                        
081                // assemble the complete view transformation [R|T]:
082//              RealMatrix RT = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 4);
083//              RT.setSubMatrix(R.getData(), 0, 0);
084//              RT.setColumnVector(3, t);
085                
086                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(R, t);
087                return view;
088        }
089        
090}
